thread.title: Xueda Education to Delist From NYSE in $350 Million Deal
thread.title_full: Xueda Education to Delist From NYSE in $350 Million Deal

title: Xueda Education to Delist From NYSE in $350 Million Deal
text:
Xueda Education Strikes $350 Million Deal, Will Delist From NYSE Xueda Education’s chief executive is confident China markets provide better valuations despite the recent turmoil By Eva Dou in Beijing and Eva Dou Rick Carew in Hong Kong Rick Carew rick.carew@wsj.com Updated July 27, 2015 12:06 p.m. ET 
The latest deal from Tsinghua Unigroup Ltd., a state-owned investment firm, suggests some Chinese companies still see opportunity despite the market’s gyrations. 
China’s Xueda Education Group has agreed to be purchased by a Tsinghua Unigroup-controlled company listed on the Shenzhen stock exchange for around $350 million, Jin Xin, the education firm’s chief executive officer, said Monday. Xueda Education will delist from the New York... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Popular on WSJ
